PAGES.title: Getting Started
PAGES.body: Welcome to CSTC XXXgit add! Are YOU ready to dive into the world of Cloud Technology? In the last 10 - 15 years, the Cloud has transformed how businesses manage their applications and infrastructure. Whether you're an established professional or just beginning your journey, this class is designed to introduce Cloud technologies. Terms like (SaaS, IaaS, PaaS) and others will add to your "tech jargon!" Get ready for a face-paced class covering various areas of Cloud and help prepare for CompTIA's Cloud Essentials+Links to an external site. Certification Exam. Your first step? Post Introduction OR Click on the "Next" link (below)

PAGES.title: Read first, In Module 1 of Class
PAGES.body: Welcome to the Module 1, you'll introduce yourself, watch videos for information about grading and review Simple Syllabus. Grading timeframe is Saturday 1/11/2025 00:00:00 to Sunday 1/19/2025 11:59:00PM Module 1 sections include: Orientation Post Introduction (post introduction, respond to other students) Review Videos covering my approach on Grading and Study Each Module Review Introduction to Course at CompTIA's courseware sit Review Simple Syllabus, post any questions in Water Cooler Please participate at least 3 days in the discussions. All posts, including replies to your peers, count towards the points listed in the rubric (listed in Simple Syllabus). Assignments All Labs, Videos, Notes, Practice Questions and Practice Assessments or PBQ's need to be completed for each section to receive credit. Complete the following assignments by 11:59pm (Student's Time Zone) on Sunday. The schedule is listed in Simple Syllabus

PAGES.title: Read first, In Module 2 of Class
PAGES.body:
Welcome to the Module 2:

Grading timeframe is Saturday 1/20/2025 00:00:00 to Sunday 02/02/2025 11:59:00PM

Module 2 sections include:

  • Lesson 1 Online Work

    • Topics

    • Reviews

    • Flashcards – 48

    • Labs

  • Lesson 1 – PBQ / Practice Questions

  • Discussion Board

As you work through each section, add questions or observations for others to provide feedback. Please participate at least 3 days in the discussions. All posts, including replies to your peers, count towards the points listed in the rubric.

Assignments

All Labs, Videos, Notes, Practice Questions and Practice Assessments or PBQ's need to be completed for each section to receive credit with a green checkmark. Complete the following assignments by 11:59pm (Student's Time Zone) on Sunday. The schedule is listed in Simple Syllabus

PAGES.title: Read first, In Module 7 of Class
PAGES.body:
Welcome to the Module 7

. This module focuses on studnets taking the Cloud Essentials+ Final Assessment. If necessary, take the exam more than once to get comfortable taking the exam. One approach taking exams within the timeframe is not get stuck on PBQ questions. Go through the test, mark questions you want to review to not get held up to early in the test.

PAGES.title: Read first, In Module 8 of Class
PAGES.body:
Welcome to the Module 8

This module focuses on planning the date you'll 'sit' for your exam. The final exam requires students to take the CompTIA exam. Review the Simple Syllabus for grading. If a student does not 'sit', pass or fail the portion of their grade will receive 0%
